questions.question_text:
An IS auditor follows up on a recent security incident and finds the incident response was not adequate. Which of the following findings should be considered
MOST critical?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A: Periodic tabletop exercises involving key stakeholders.

Tabletop exercises are simulations of cybersecurity incidents that involve key stakeholders from various departments and roles within an organization. These exercises help test and validate the effectiveness of the incident response process in a controlled and collaborative environment. They allow participants to practice their roles, identify weaknesses or gaps in the process, and improve coordination among different teams. Furthermore, tabletop exercises provide an opportunity to refine and update the incident response plan based on the lessons learned during the simulation.

While options B, C, and D are important aspects of maintaining an effective incident response process, tabletop exercises go beyond documentation updates, training, or reporting incidents. They provide a real-world simulation that can help identify and address issues that may not become apparent through other means. Therefore, option A is the most comprehensive and proactive approach to ensuring the effectiveness of the cybersecurity incident response process.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the BEST way for management to ensure the effectiveness of the cybersecurity incident response process?

choices.B: Periodic update of incident response process documentation
choices.C: Periodic cybersecurity training for staff involved in incident response
choices.D: Periodic reporting of cybersecurity incidents to key stakeholders
choices.A: Periodic tabletop exercises involving key stakeholders

questions.question_text: When reviewing a project to replace multiple manual data entry systems with an artificial intelligence (Al) system, the IS auditor should be MOST concerned with the impact Al will have on:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. enterprise architecture (EA).
 Implementing AI systems can have significant implications for the overall enterprise architecture. AI systems often require integration with existing systems, data sources, and processes. Changes to the enterprise architecture may be necessary to accommodate the AI system's requirements. This includes considerations such as data storage, data flows, security, scalability, and compatibility with existing IT infrastructure. Ensuring that the AI system aligns with the enterprise's architecture is crucial to avoid disruptions and maintain the overall stability and efficiency of the organization's IT environment.
All the options are relevant, the IS auditor's primary concern should be how the implementation of AI impacts the organization's enterprise architecture, as this can have widespread effects on IT systems and processes.
I think its B as well

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a core functionality of a configuration and release management system?

choices.C: Deploying a configuration change to the sandbox environment
choices.D: Managing privileged access to databases, servers, and infrastructure
choices.A: Identifying other configuration items that will be impacted by a given change

discussion.content:
A core functionality of a configuration and release management system is to identify other configuration items that will be impacted by a given change. This involves assessing the dependencies and relationships between various configuration items within an IT infrastructure to understand how changes to one item may affect others. By identifying these dependencies, the system helps ensure that changes are implemented in a coordinated and controlled manner, minimizing the risk of unintended consequences or disruptions to the system.
A is right answer
